   (Team' representative)  should pass an online Test. The Best 50 Teams
   scores will be qualified to the IDEATHON.
   3. March 18-19, 2023: *IDEATHON*:  48H Ideation Camp with Mentors and
   Investors Brainstorming.
   4. APRIL-JULY 2023: *ACCELERATION SESSIONS*: 10 accelerations sessions
   in different field.
   5. JUNE 2023:* MAKEATHON & FINAL NATIONAL FEST* during the Annual *NRW
   Event:*  selection of three Winners to be qualified to the International
   FEST in one of Arabic countries in order to compete with startups from *=
15
   countries and win $30K*.
   6. September'22, 2023:  *International Final FEST*

Date: mer. 4 janv. 2023 =C3=A0 12:53
Subject: Smartleap is recruiting a freelancer
To:




Client needs an online booking solution that is viewable in both mobile and
desktop browsers and charges customers in dinars. With this, We are
proposing to provide the client with services for its Web Design project.
The company will create a basic website design and add user management,
order placement, chat and feedback features to the website. Through this
website, the client will be able to provide customers with a convenient
online booking experience.



Problem

The client, an owner of multiple rental apartments in Tunisia, is missing
the ability to offer his rental apartments in dinars. To facilitate  and
remain competitive in the industry, the client plans to create an online
booking solution and facilitate local customers acquisition.



Solution

Through this Rental Marketplace Web Design project, the client will launch
its own booking website so customers can conveniently book its rental
apartments. With online booking made possible by the new website the client
expects to see increased sales, and better customer experience.






Objectives

We aim to achieve the following objectives for this project:

Create a basic design for the website
Add user management, order placement, chat features, and feedback features
Launch the website



Benefits

The website will allow the client=E2=80=99s customers to book its rental ap=
artments
online using dinar, thereby adding to its product sales in online
marketplaces. The online booking option also improves the client=E2=80=99s
competitive edge, allowing the client to remain profitable.

Please send your CV to direction.smartleap@gmail.com

---------- Forwarded message ---------

First of all, I would like to thank on behalf of Karim Hajjaji and the SCIB
team for the warm welcome you gave us during our visit to ESPRIT. We have
had a very good impression of ESPRIT's training approach and the quality of
the talent that is trained at your university, especially after the
stimulating conversation with you. Therefore, we believe that we are in a
position to begin to see candidates from your university and to explore a
fruitful partnership between the ESPRIT and Santander Corporate &
Investment Banking (SCIB, https://www.santandercib.com/about-us/talent-
 culture).



To advance in this possible relationship, we consider that:



1.      Probably, the *first step* would be to *present specific CVs of a
group of recent graduates to SCIB Hiring Managers* to understand their
possible suitability for the global professional opportunities that we are
offering from SCIB in the Malaga and Warsaw Hubs. In this sense, in the
attached documents you will be able to see the description of several
technological profiles, as well as project or business analyst, in which
ESPRIT graduates could fit. By the way, those who have dual nationality
from a country of the European Union will have an easier time obtaining
work visas.

2.      In addition, the possibility of being able to share professional
offers for more senior profiles that can be disseminated from the ESPRIT in
your *Alumni network* or among Executive Education students has been very
suggestive. In this link you can see right now all the vacancies available
for the Malaga Hub,
https://santander.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/SantanderCareers?q=3Dmalaga&s=
ource=3DBeTech

3.      After these first steps, it would be feasible to explore other
actions that allow us to build the relationship. In this sense, the
possibility of participating in the Hackathon that you are going to
organize on May 2023 or SCIB presentations on your campus would be good
options to progress, beyond sharing with you the professional opportunities
of the SCIB Hubs.

Finally, we would appreciate it if you could fill in the following table
with the information that we have identified as most relevant regarding the
training of ESPRIT talent of interest to SCIB.

[image: HPE Insider]

*HPE All-in Event*
HPE Tunisia Cultural Diversity Network





[image: HPE_eNewsletter_icon_date]

October 14, 2022
HPE Tunisia | You're invited to HPE All-in DE&I Event

[image: HPE_eNewsletter_bar]



Dear *ESPRIT Team*,

Valuing diversity, equity & inclusion is=E2=80=AFa vital part of what succe=
ss looks
like in our organisation. We=E2=80=99ve=E2=80=AFmade positive steps in rece=
nt years to
embed DE&I=E2=80=AFin our work, and we=E2=80=99re committed to doing more, =
thus, we are
organizing the HPE All-in Event with students and Academic community to
demystify Diversity, Equity & Inclusion in workplace.

HPE Tunisia Diversity, Equity & Inclusion team is inviting students to be
part of our event *HPE All-in* to be held on *Wednesday, 26 October 2022*
at *10h00*, in the premises of Hewlett Packard Entreprise at Technopole El
Ghazala, Ariana.

The aim is to gather nearly 100 students in this event; thus, we would be
happy if you share *the attached invitation* with ESPRIT Students, to give
them the opportunity to hear from our guests and leaders about the
importance of this topic and to learn more about the potential of DE&I in
workplace and among community.

We look forward welcoming at least 20 from ESPRIT students in this event.


About the Event

[image: HPE_eNewsletter_bar]

In this session, participants, HPE Leaders, students, academic and NGO
representatives, will demystify why engaging with diversity equity and
inclusion is important in creating unbiased and healthy workplace and
communities where everyone feels a sense of belonging.

Our Leaders are glad to run this experience with students of Today and
Talents of Tomorrow so here below the agenda details of the event:



*Date *

October 26, 2022

*Time*

09h030 am to 12h00 pm

*Location*

HPE Office in Technopole El Ghazela, Ariana Tunisia

*Agenda*

*09h30:
<https://community.hpe.com/t5/Software-Defined-Infrastructure/ct-p/Integrat=
edSystems>*
Welcome at reception



*10h00: HPE Inside the Element Panel* to explore with HPE leaders DEI
topics from different focal points



*11h00:* * From outside the Element Panel* with NGO representatives to
Speak up, and highlight actions taken to sustain and champion efforts to
accelerate DEI.



*12h00:* Closing of the session with a Coffee Break

*Language*

Mixed Tunisian Arabic, English and French









*What is HPE All-in Event?*

   - Is an event when HPE team members and Students join an informative
   session about HPE Diversity, Equity & Inclusive working environment.
   - Students will join the event and ask questions to our Leaders and NGO
   representatives who will respond to all the queries about the inclusive
   workplace.



=C2=B7       *Why YOU should participate:*

This is an opportunity to discover the ICT industry from inside the element
and enjoy a day with HPE leaders and NGO representatives and interact with
them about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion





*THANK YOU* in advance for considering this invitation .

For questions or comments please email us at *hazar.el-kebir@hpe.com
<hazar.el-kebir@hpe.com>.*





Best Regards,

*Hazar El Kebir*
HPE Tunisia Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Lead

column3:
CREACT4MED CCI Entrepreneurship Academy: Call for Trainees - Deadline
 15 April
column4:
multipart/relatedmultipart/alternativetext/plain[image: image.png]


Dear all,



This is the last reminder for the Call for Trainees for the CREACT4MED CCI
Entrepreneurship Academy

*Deadline for applications*: *15 April 2022*



This free training course is designed to help entrepreneurs, startups and
MSMEs navigate the high-risk early stages of business development and
strengthen CCI businesses in the Mediterranean, ultimately contributing to
sustainable economic development in the region.

Successful trainees will have access to the MED CCI HUB and the CREACT4MED
Alumni Network, which offers networking opportunities, capacity building,
enhanced visibility, and access to regional events and financial providers.

Furthermore, successful participants will have the opportunity to apply for
a subgrant of up to =E2=82=AC15,000 for their business venture.



To be eligible to apply for the CREACT4MED training programme, applicants
must:

   - Be an MSME or startup owner, or creative entrepreneur active in the
   cultural and creative industries
   - Be based or registered in Egypt, Jordan, Lebanon, Morocco, Palestine
   or Tunisia
   - Have a good command of English



For the more information on the call and how to apply please visit:

https://creativemediterranean.org/cci-entrepreneurship-academy-call-for-tra=
inees-now-open/



If you also think that there may be interested persons/organisations among
your contacts we would be grateful if you could further disseminate the
attached brochure.



*CREACT4MED <https://creativemediterranean.org/> aims to boost
entrepreneurship and job creation for youth and women through the cultural
and creative industries in the Southern Neighborhood of the European Union.
The project is co-funded by the European Union under the EuropeAid
Programme and by the Project Partners, led by the Euro-Mediterranean
Economists Association (EMEA) <https://euromed-economists.org/>*



Best regards,
 *P=C3=B4le Employabilit=C3=A9 ESPRIT*

 Z. I. Chotrana II, B.P. : 160

2083 P=C3=B4le Technologique El Ghazala =E2=80=93 TUNISIE
